docs.lead_paragraph: Businesses and Wall Street are on the rebound, but people out of work or underemployed continue to suffer as benefits expire and job searches fail.

headline.seo: What Recovery? For the Unemployed, the Pain Gets Worse
headline.main: What Recovery? For the Unemployed, the Pain Gets Worse
headline.print_headline: What Recovery? For the Unemployed, the Pain Gets Worse

docs.snippet: Businesses and Wall Street are on the rebound, but people out of work or underemployed continue to suffer as benefits expire and job searches fail.

docs.lead_paragraph: There's nothing worse than showing up on time for a doctor's appointment and then having to wait because the physician is running late. Because insurers tend to pay a certain amount for each patient doctors see and each procedure they perform rather than for the time spent with a patient, doctors have an incentive to see as many patients as they can and often double-book patients for 10-to-15-minute appointment time slots.
docs.abstract: Bucks blog discusses irritation that accompanies long waits for doctors; photo (S)
docs.snippet: There's nothing worse than showing up on time for a doctor's appointment and then having to wait because the physician is running late.     Because insurers tend to pay a certain amount for each patient doctors see and each procedure they perform...

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Friday Reading: Guarantees for Oil-Free Stays

docs.abstract: Gulf Coast hotels offering refunds for oil spill-related beach closings, what the latest unemployment figures mean and other consumer-focused items from Friday's Times.
docs.snippet: Gulf Coast hotels offering refunds for oil spill-related beach closings, what the latest unemployment figures mean and other consumer-focused items from Friday's Times.

headline.main: Must Insurers Cover Adult Children Never Before on a Parent's Plan?

docs.abstract: As long as the plan covers dependents and the adult child can't get coverage through his own job, the new health care law requires that the insurer allow him to be added to a parent's policy.
docs.snippet: As long as the plan covers dependents and the adult child can't get coverage through his own job, the new health care law requires that the insurer allow him to be added to a parent's policy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first legal challenge of the health care law was brought to federal court Thursday in Virginia, one of 21 states seeking to invalidate the law.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new poll suggests a small increase in favorable views of the new health care law since May, but it is still unclear if many people will see tangible benefits before the November elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The small-business jobs bill now under consideration in the Senate is a hearty mélange of tax relief-provisions, loan-program enhancements and inducements, and changes to other government programs. Some are temporary modifications but others are permanent and far-reaching.

headline.main: What's in the Senate Small-Business Jobs Bill for You

docs.abstract: Highlights of the many tax relief-provisions, loan-program enhancements and other changes.
docs.snippet: Highlights of the many tax relief-provisions, loan-program enhancements and other changes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday I wrote about survey findings that showed young people were most optimistic about their earnings over the coming year. In fact, the older the respondent, the less likely they were to say their financial circumstances would improve in the next year.

headline.main: Young People: Hopeful, or Just Realistic?

docs.abstract: Maybe young people are more hopeful about their financial circumstances over the next year because, statistically speaking, their earnings are expected to rise with age.
docs.snippet: Maybe young people are more hopeful about their financial circumstances over the next year because, statistically speaking, their earnings are expected to rise with age.
